TopicTitle: Jool Landing inquiry. Wondering what's been tried.

Articles.Content: I see people who seem to have landed on Jool, but in almost all instances their ships explode. So.. wanted to ask.. has anyone tried making an egg for a lander.. and landing on jool? I'm talking like a diamond shaped structure reinforced upon reinforced by struts to try and resist the pressure.

It is possible to reach 0 altitude on Jool, but the planet has no solid surface, so you will fall right through and continue downwards. It is roughly about -100 m (I think) when weird things start happening. I've never personally tried to use a reinforced lander, but I can't imagine that it will hold up for long--the Kracken lives in the depths of Jool's atmosphere.
The game will kill your craft unless a rare bug happens where you actually hit ground
Last time I tried, my probe spontaneously disintegrated at 250m below Jool's surface. Since the probe ran out of batteries before transmitting the low atmosphere data, I'll have to send another one.
I seen a video on youtube and the probe crashed, destroying parts on it then bounced up, then fell again, crashed and the remaining parts were destroyed. think he got to - 5 meters

I just saw in the science library you can get 1200 science by landing on jool and taking a surface sample and returning with it.. question is.. how in the world to do that. I'm assuming if you got to 0 since someone planted a flag there,, if you eva'd without falling off you might be bale to pull off a surface sample. But then returning.. that'd be about impossible?

Problem is that Jool don't have a solid surface, at least not anymore, back in 0.19 it had a sort of surface but it broke anything who landed on it.

This surface was on -100 meter but is removed so now you go to -500 and explode same way as going to close to sun.

I have been down where many times.

New Jool

http://imgur.com/a/dahmU#0

Old Jool.

this one I send Jeb down on but he was unable to plant the flag.

Think surface sample from sun is also an node.
Simply, you fall through the surface where your craft will be crushed below -250 meters. Parachutes or not, it doesn't matter your decent speed. There is no solid surface to land on.
Ah, so it is now definitely hard core programmed to obliterate ya. Understood.

Ah, so it is now definitely hard core programmed to obliterate ya. Understood.

Game has a crash zone under the terrain, this is to crash your ship if you crash in multiple km/s perhaps under warp.

Jool and sun only have the crash zone.

its a bit stupid they changed it, might be because I submitted an bug report as I could not plant the flag on Jool.

That was the purpose of the balloons and the cables.
